name: nytimes
text:
We continue to track Hurricane Sally, which made landfall Wednesday morning near Gulf Shores, Alabama, as a Category 2 hurricane, with sustained winds over 105 mph.  

The slow-moving storm is expected to bring “catastrophic” flooding. https://t.co/4emdCo5ogy

name: nytimes
text:
More than two feet of rain had fallen in Pensacola, Florida, by 6:30 a.m. — and meteorologists warned of worse flooding to come as the storm crawls ashore.

We’ve mapped the rainfall forecast along Sally’s path. https://t.co/lROE7LmfvD https://t.co/S5xmRS7x58

name: nytimes
text:
The hurricane weakened from a Category 2 to a Category 1 after making landfall, but its deluge was not forecast to let up any time soon and hurricane-force winds continued to pound the Alabama coast and the Florida Panhandle.

Follow our live updates: https://t.co/mHkjmm4hLu

name: nytimes
